content.question: The height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and collar size <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, both in centimeters, measured from a sample of boys were used to create the regression line <math alttext="c hat, equals negative 94 plus 0.9 times h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>94</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.9</mn><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The line is used to predict collar size from height, both in centimeters, for boys’ shirt collars. Which of the following has no logical interpretation in context?

choices.label: The predicted collar size of a boy with height <math alttext="140 centimeters " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>140</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
The <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> values in the sample
The <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> values in the sample
The slope of the regression line
The <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-intercept of the regression line

content.answer: The <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-intercept of the regression line

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
